title.narrative: Himachal Pradesh Public Financial Management Capacity Building Program

description.narrative: The Project Development Objective (PDO) is to improve the efficiency of Public Expenditure Management and Tax Administration in Himachal Pradesh.

condition.narrative: Himachal Pradesh to (i) not later than 03 months after Effectiveness Date, appoint an independent verification agency (IVA) underterms and reference satisfactory to the Bank, to carry out the verification of compliance of DLIs, (ii) carry out a verificationprocess guided by a Verification Protocol agreed with the Bank, and (iii) furnish to the Bank the corresponding verificationreports in form and substance acceptable to the Bank, not later than 30 days after the end of each of the periods under review, inorder to submit evidence satisfactory to the Bank of the achievement of said DLIs for disbursement.

Himachal Pradesh to: (i) join the Bank in the carrying out of a Mid-Term Review to assess the overall progress in implementation ofthe Program; (ii) prepare and furnish to the Bank, at least three (3) months prior to such review, a report, in scope and detailacceptable to the Bank, needed to undertake the review; and (iii) review, jointly with the Bank, the report referred above andthereafter take all measures required to ensure the efficient completion of the Program and the achievement of the objectivesthereof, based on the conclusions and recommendations of said report and the Bank’s views on the matter.

In the event that: (i) a reversal of a previous DLI has occurred in a manner that would, in the opinion of the Bank, adverselyaffect the achievement of the objectives of the Program; and (ii) said previous DLI has already been vetted by the IVA(s) using theVerification Protocol agreed with the Bank, and for which the corresponding disbursements have been already made by the Bank; theBorrower shall refund the disbursements already made by the Bank for said previous DLIs.

The Borrower may withdraw: (i) an amount not to exceed US$ 7,200,000 as an advance; provided, however, that if the DLIs in theopinion of the Bank, are not achieved (or only partially achieved) by the Closing Date, the Borrower shall refund such advance tothe Bank promptly upon notice thereof by the Bank. Except as otherwise agreed with the Borrower, the Bank shall cancel the amountso refunded. Any further withdrawals requested as an advance under any Category shall be permitted only on such terms andconditions as the Bank shall specify by notice to the Borrower.

The Borrower shall cause Himachal Pradesh to ensure that the Program is carried out in accordance with financial management,procurement and environmental and social management systems mutually acceptable to the Bank, including those set out in the ESSA,the Program Manual and the Program Action Plan (“Program Fiduciary, Environmental and Social Systems”).
The Borrower shall cause Himachal Pradesh to maintain at all times during implementation, a Program Steering Committee to providestrategic leadership and inter-departmental coordination.

title.narrative: Enhanced capacity of officials implementing GST by providing training not covered by the sovereign function

baseline.value: GST rollout training to be imparted and systematic training instituted for the department

target.value: Field-level staff of the ETD trained in functional aspects of GST. Additionally, training and communication provided to dealers.

actual.value: Training is ongoing subject to COVID 19 disruptions

title.narrative: Strengthening components of the PFM cycle through analytical studies of the core FD functions

baseline.value: No recent studies (last review during PEFA 2009) conducted to refine the core functions

target.value: Recommendations made to the GoHP on fund, debt, revenue, and expenditure management

actual.value: DeMPA is complete and its recommendations may form part of revised DLIs. PEFA has commenced - it is however delayed due to impactof COVID 19

title.narrative: Backlog of pending VAT/ CST assessments reduced

baseline.value: Pending tax assessments (VAT and CST) is 294,000 (2011/12–2015/16)

target.value: Backlog reduced by 100% over baseline and (90% of) in-year assessments completed within 1 year of return filing

actual.value: Backlog reduced, target of in-years assessments met. Year 2 target of DLI being verified by the IVA.

title.narrative: Increased value of transactions processed through the e-Procurement system

baseline.value: Software implemented in 5 departments and 15 parastatals with sporadic usage (of the six modules) and value of transactionsprocessed at INR 24.41 billion for value of tenders uploaded and INR 1.88 billion for value of contracts awarded

target.value: Increase in value of transactions processed through the e-Procurement system by 90% over baseline

actual.value: Target achieved for FY 21 - 22. Value of transactions processed through the e-Procurement system increased by 90% over baseline.

title.narrative: Strengthening PFM in the state by provision of comprehensive and wide-ranging training

baseline.value: Training neither strategic nor according to a plan

target.value: Development of training needs assessment, training plan, and provision of adequate resources to deliver required training to allstakeholders

actual.value: E-learning modules on e-Procurement and CMS have been prepared. DoTA and NIC are working towards creating e-learning modules onIFMIS. Regular training being imparted though not in last 5 months.

title.narrative: Reduce variance between originally approved budget to expenditure

baseline.value: Variance (absolute) between originally approved budget to expenditure outturns of six large departments (demand heads) was 19%(FY2015–16)

target.value: Variance between originally approved budget to expenditure outturns of six large departments(demand heads) reduced to 15%

actual.value: Target for FY 21-22 achieved after restructuring. Variance between originally approved budget to expenditure outturns of six largedepartments(demand heads) reduced to 15%.

title.narrative: Institutional strengthening and modernization of the ETD

baseline.value: Weak institutional and organization structure and obsolete e-applications

target.value: All accepted short- and medium-term recommendations implemented including optimizing the assessing function

actual.value: Recommendations are being implemented. EIU has been established and Service Tax Unit, and Tax Audit Unit are being strengthened.DLI under verification.
